properties.name: Mackenzie Park Canyon
properties.description: Core canyon area within Mackenzie Park. Early settlers and indigenous peoples utilized this canyon corridor for water, shelter, and transportation. Today, it is a recreational and heritage area.

properties.name: Dunbar Historical Lake
properties.description: Historic and cultural park; early water management site. Archaeological evidence suggests that settlers and indigenous peoples relied on this water source for survival and agriculture.

properties.name: Canyon Lakes System
properties.description: Central artificial lakes in the canyon used for recreation and drainage. Historically, the canyon corridor guided settlement patterns and the development of water management systems.

properties.name: Lower Canyon Corridor
properties.description: Section toward eastern Lubbock; influenced historical settlement patterns. Early inhabitants used this corridor for travel, hunting, and settlement due to proximity to water and fertile land.

properties.name: Yellow House Canyon Route
properties.description: Historic corridor along Yellow House Canyon used by Indigenous groups and early settlers. Influenced road placement and settlement patterns.
